Expected Competancy.Title: Strategic Leadership & Ownership
Competencies: Drive the vision for secure software delivery across the organization.
Act as an advocate for security-first culture.
Mentor security engineers and influence best practices across teams.
Resolve conflicts between speed and security trade-offs effectively.
Be accountable for compliance and audit readiness.

Expected Competancy.Title: Continuous Learning & Growth
Competencies: Stay updated on evolving cyber threats and attack vectors.
Engage with security communities and certifications (CISSP, OSCP).
Lead internal training on secure coding and risk management.
Participate in industry security summits and research.
Coach teams on incident readiness and security metrics.

Expected Competancy.Title: Security Architecture & Governance
Competencies: Define enterprise-level security policies and frameworks.
Architect secure solutions for cloud, on-premise, and hybrid models.
Establish data protection strategies and encryption standards.
Integrate threat modeling into development lifecycles.
Ensure compliance with ISO, SOC2, and industry-specific regulations.

Expected Competancy.Title: Vulnerability & Risk Management
Competencies: Oversee vulnerability scanning and penetration testing programs.
Manage risk assessments across applications and infrastructure.
Lead resolution strategies for critical security incidents.
Establish automated security testing in CI/CD pipelines.
Track KPIs on incident frequency, severity, and resolution time.

Expected Competancy.Title: Secure Product Delivery
Competencies: Ensure every product feature undergoes security review.
Influence prioritization of security enhancements in backlogs.
Collaborate with engineering leads on secure design patterns.
Advocate for privacy-by-design and compliance adherence.
Ensure secure coding guidelines are followed organization-wide.

Expected Competancy.Title: Customer-Centric Security
Competencies: Integrate customer feedback on security issues.
Communicate security posture transparently to customers.
Enhance security UX, e.g., password policies and MFA.
Promote trust through certifications and attestations.
Drive adoption of secure customer-facing APIs.

Expected Competancy.Title: Security Trends & Threat Intelligence
Competencies: Track global security threats and evolving attack methods.
Implement proactive defense mechanisms based on intelligence.
Collaborate with government and industry security task forces.
Publish thought leadership on enterprise security.
Benchmark organizational security posture against industry leaders.

Expected Competancy.Title: Technology Evangelism
Competencies: Represent organization at security forums and conferences.
Promote secure engineering internally and externally.
Lead open-source contributions for security tools.
Develop partnerships with security solution providers.
Coach external partners/vendors on security compliance.
